Body: I'd like to integrate AWS C++ SDK into a new ESP-IDF project
column9:
as a component. As I can see the AWS one uses CMake as opposed to ESP-IDF which uses "old-style" component.mk (I'm not sure how it is called).

I tried using ESP-IDF cmake branch and configuring stuff together with no luck. It is all vague to me.

Other way could be to migrate AWS C++ SDK onto the ESP-IDF's "old-style" platform. I'd prefer this as there are other libs using this style so that they don't have to be ported.

Question
column10:
which way to go? How to do it? What are the steps to accomplish this?

UPDATE:

I've decided to go for the ESP-IDF / "old-style" way. What I've done so far is to create folder components/aws-iot where I cloned the AWS-SDK
column11: created a component.mk similarly to this
column12:
with the following content:

COMPONENT_ADD_INCLUDEDIRS := aws-iot-device-sdk-cpp/include aws-iot-device-sdk-cpp/network/OpenSSL /usr/local/opt/openssl/include	COMPONENT_SRCDIRS := aws-iot-device-sdk-cpp/src	COMPONENT_SUBMODULES := aws-iot-device-sdk-cpp

I took the PubSub example and copied it into my project's main folder. When I'm compiling it throws an error: components/aws-iot/aws-iot-device-sdk-cpp/network/OpenSSL/OpenSSLConnection.hpp:41:25: fatal error: openssl/err.h: No such file or directory compilation terminated.

Note that I added OpenSSL's include dir but it seems to be ignoring it. Any idea? Thanks.

"

Body: I'd like to use the C++ SDK, not the C one if possible.

Can you elaborate a bit on what you're trying to do?  Do you want something like an ESP32 directly calling a Lambda or something?  The ESP toolkit has example [AWS IoT](https://github.com/espressif/esp-idf/tree/master/examples/protocols/aws_iot) code that works well.
